name: Suffocation
description: Creatures that run out of breath or are choking suffer exhaustion from lack of oxygen
trigger: Running out of breath while underwater, being strangled, breathing toxic gas, or otherwise unable to breathe
duration: ongoing until creature can breathe again

breathHolding.note: Creature can hold its breath before suffocation begins

ongoing: When out of breath or choking, gains 1 Exhaustion level at the end of each of its turns

mitigation: Move to area with breathable air
Have high Constitution modifier for longer breath-holding duration
Creatures that don't need to breathe are immune

recovery.immediate: When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of Exhaustion it gained from suffocating
recovery.note: This is an exception to normal Exhaustion removal rules

srdReference.quote: A creature can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 plus its Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds) before suffocation begins. When a creature runs out of breath or is choking, it gains 1 Exhaustion level at the end of each of its turns. When a creature can breathe again, it removes all levels of Exhaustion it gained from suffocating.

examples: Drowning underwater - Con modifier 2 means can hold breath 3 minutes
Being strangled by a rope or creature
Trapped in airless room or container
Buried alive under debris or earth
Inhaling thick smoke that prevents breathing
Magic effect that removes air from area

specialCases.name: Deep Water
specialCases.description: After each hour swimming in deep water (100+ feet), creature without Swim Speed must succeed on DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 Exhaustion level (from pressure and cold, not suffocation)

specialCases.name: Frigid Water
specialCases.description: Creature can be immersed for minutes equal to Constitution score before ill effects, then DC 10 Constitution save each additional minute or gain 1 Exhaustion level
